content: alocasia is a slightly batwing pullover worked in one piece from the top down with modified drop shoulders with a double v-neck in the back and the front the neckline is highlighted by a band of crossed stitches which extends down the center front of the pullover an i-cord edging gives the neckline a polished look to offer all the lovely details of the alocasia pullover to those who do not want to wear a v-neck in the back i have come up with a variation with a round back neckline the explanations for this variation are available by buying the pattern sizes finished bust measurements 85 95 105 115 125 135 cm / 33 ½ 37 ½ 41 ¼ 45 ¼ 49 ¼ 53 ¼ ins materials yarn approx 900 1020 1140 1260 1380 1500 meters/ 980 1110 1240 1370 1500 1640 yards of solid or semi-solid fingering weight yarn the sample was knit with a 100 % merino fingering weight yarn 400 m 440 yds per 100 g skein needles 3 5 mm/us size 4 80 cm/32 ins minimum circular needle or size needed to obtain the correct gauge for the body and the sleeves 3 mm/us size 2 needles for the lower edge ribbing of body and sleeves notions crochet hook similar to larger needle size stitch markers stitch holders and waste yarn a smooth yarn for the crochet provisional co tapestry needle gauge 26 stitches and 34 row = 10 cm in stockinette stitch on the larger needles after blocking the pattern was translated in english by lila 1 --------- tout le devant du pull deux versions du pull alocasia sont proposées en fonction de la profondeur du décolleté tailles tour de buste sur le vêtement fini 85 95 105 115 125 135 cm profondeur de aiguilles aiguilles circulaires de 80 cm de long en taille 3 5 mm pour le corps et en taille 3 mm pour les finitions bas du corps et bas des manches autres aiguille de tapissier pour rentrer les fils
